video.description:
Just my friend Nathan Mitchell and I waking up at 5 am.  No permits, 3 takes.  I just strongly believe that the camera should move with the dancer, and that needs to be a dance as well, especially when it comes to eye contact to lens.

Song Harlem River by KEVIN MORBY
video.title: Fred Astaire with a stomach full of Corn Chips and Valium
video.html: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/123964750" width="480" height="270" frameborder="0" title="Fred Astaire with a stomach full of Corn Chips and Valium" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

video.description:
This emotional test was inspired by Charlotte Rampling and her performance in Woody Allen's Stardust Memory. I basically wanted to give Nola a line, and have her say it at the beginning of the shoot, and then have her repeat lines, emotions, answer questions and even sing an emotional song, before having to repeat the same line "i am Nola" again, to show a difference in 3 simple words.

Directed/Edited/Concept: Phillip R Lopez
DP: Kate Arizmendi.
video.title: I Am Nola.  (an emotional Test)
video.html: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/161692964" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" title="I Am Nola.  (an emotional Test)" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

video.description:
Morgan Quinn, just dancing her way through Chinatown in the early blue of a sunrise in Los Angeles, Ca.  

Directed.Edited.Shot by Phillip R Lopez

video.description:
A short film about gender roles, trans, and what's it like to have an identity that deviates from the status quo. 

Produced and starring Ruby Rose
Directed by Phillip R Lopez
Music by: butterfly Boucher "it pulls me under"
Styled by: phoebe Dahl 
Edited by: Phillip r Lopez
DP: Morgan mercier
video.title: Break Free OFFICIAL SHORT with Ruby Rose
